posts.name: Mohammad Awwad
posts.cooked:
Hello, I am currently working on a swerve drivetrain robot with the MK4i modules with falcons and have begun to receive the following error

I am not quite sure why this is happening as I believe I am using the integrated sensor in the correct way, this is the code on line 74 of the SwerveModule.java file when the error is first caught

posts.name: Benjamin Hall
posts.cooked:
Just a note, the SensorCollection methods update their values every >100ms, so unless you have a different sensor configured as the selected sensor, you’ll probably want to use driveMotor.getSelectedSensorPosition() instead.

I’m pretty sure we report that error whenever a signal is older than 255ms, so depending on the CAN bus utilization and the status signal period of the integrated sensor frame, it may actually be stale. Using the getSelectedSensor*() methods would fix that issue. Otherwise, I would double check CAN IDs in Phoenix Tuner and the LEDs on the device.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics

posts.custom_user_title: Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics

posts.name: Jacob Caporuscio
posts.cooked: In addition to @bhall-ctre ’s points, that error message indicates you’re constructing a Talon FX object to be on a CANivore bus named “can”.  Double check that this name matches the CANivore name, or if you’re not using a CANivore remove the bus name from the constructor call.

posts.name: Mohammad Awwad
posts.cooked: that is correct as I am using a CANivore called “can”, I will give the getSelectedSensor() a try though and see if that fixes the problem

posts.name: Stewart Riley
posts.cooked: To add to this, you probably are having problems because of CAN bus utilization. With eight Falcons and the swerve units’ encoders all on the bus, it’s easy to bog things down. Try eliminating as much CAN traffic as possible. We had this problem last year until we realized that we were getting sensor values we didn’t really need reported every 100ms. Once we fixed this, no more frame too stale errors.

posts.name: Mohammad Awwad
posts.cooked:

thanks for the response, the error does seem to have gone now
